captions.text:
From the ruins of an iconic bombed-out palace
above Kabul, a young Afghan man bearing a

striking resemblance to kung fu legend Bruce
Lee, is high-kicking his way to internet fame.

Videos and photos of Abbas Alizada posted
on the Facebook page Bruce Hazara show him

performing back flips and striking Lee's famous
poses.

They blazed through Afghanistan's very small
Internet community this week, part of a publicity

burst that the 20-year-old hopes will catapult
him to broader fame.

I want to be Afghan Bruce lee in the future,
not only in Afghanistan but a symbol of Bruce

Lee in the world. I dream to be a champion
as Bruce lee was and my great ambition is
to be a Hollywood star in the future.

Sporting a Lee-like bowl haircut, Alizada
trains twice a week, showing off his wiry

physique, doing push-ups on his fingertips
and sparring with a partner.

Nobody has supported me as of yet in Afghanistan,
my talent is hidden. Neither the government

nor anybody else supports me in my sport careers,
I do my best using my own resources to become
a champion for my country in the future.

Alizada is from a poor family of 10 children.
His parents couldn't afford the fees at an

academy of Wushu, which is a Chinese mixed
martial art, but the trainer there took him

title: Is this man Bruce Lee's reincarnation...in Afghanistan?
